intro: Torrubia domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican torrubia, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
